result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Batt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$250 payment due on or before jail report date of 11/23/15.  Balance of court costs due during first 6 months of supervision.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Inform agent of all prescriptions and keep them in original containers.
No contact with victims DB, SJ, DR or their residence.
No contact with co-defendant

Defendant to coooperate in a counseling assessment and any follow-up treatment deemed appropriate by DOC.
Submit to DNA and pay surcharge

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

records.addlTxt: Reflects payment of $250.00. Forwarded to DOC Cashiers Unit.
$250.00 payment received on behalf of Christopher Batt.

Defendant Christopher J Batt in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendation given by the State. Statement by victim. Defense statement. Court renders sentence.
of Jury Trial
Sentencing hearing at 11-18-2015 08:15 am

Matter set for jury trial. Defendant Christopher J Batt in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting waiver of jury, State will consent. Court gives collaque regarding waiver and will recess for defendant to confer with counsel. Recess.
9:05am In session, same appearances. Defendant will proceed with his waiver of jury trial. Court will accept waiver and releases jury.  
9:21am In session, request for sequestration of witnesses by defense. Court so orders. Stipulations between parties placed on the record. 
9:24am C.A. sworn and testified.
9:32am Sgt. John Stroik sworn and testified.
9:49am Officer Roland Kegley sworn and testified.
9:55am V.T. sworn and testified.
10:10am State rests. Defense moves to dismiss. Recess.
10:18am In session, same appearances. Colleque given by the court as to defendant's right to testify. Defense rests. Closing statement by parties. Court finds State has met its burden of proof and finds defendant guilty. Recess.
10:49am In session, same appearances. Sentencing hearing scheduled. Bail to continue.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Christopher J Batt in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel and State advises prepared for jury trial.  Court orders matter to remain on jury calendar for 11/17 at 8:30 am.  Counsel advises no jury instructions filed yet.  Court advises defense to file by the end of the business day today.

Defendant Christopher J Batt in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests jury trial. Scheduling reviewed with counsel and court. Multiple scheduling of jury due to conflict counsel has with prior scheduled trials. Jury trial to be heard either in October OR November. Counsel to notify court which date he will be available.
